title: Entertainment Live: 29 September 2015 - BBC News
summary: stars attend the pride of britain awards .
tributes to twin peaks star catherine coulson .

documents.title: thanks for dropping by
text: that 's all from us today , we hope you 've enjoyed the mix of the deep and serious with the fun and frivolous .
join us again at the same time tomorrow , that 's 08:30 bst fyi , for more of the same from the combined worlds of art , entertainment , culture and media .
author: Kev Geoghegan
Arts and entertainment reporter

documents.title: great scott ! !
text: `` it 's your kids marty , something has got to be done about your kids . ''
any true fan of back to the future will recognise the date .
21 october 2015 .
it 's the day marty mcfly arrived in his own future for the first time .

to mark the 30th-anniversary re-issue of the back to the future trilogy , universal has released a teaser for doc brown saves the world , a short extra which sees christopher lloyd reprise his role as doc emmett brown .
but what happened to his steam-powered locomotive ?
maybe time will tell

documents.title: leonardo dicaprio mauled by a bear
text: not really , of course it 's just a scene from his upcoming thriller the revenant .
based on a true story , the film follows a frontiersman who is attacked by a bear and left for dead .
after struggling through a vicious winter , he sets off to exact vengeance on the hunting team who abandoned him .
directed by alejandro gonzalez inarritu - whose film birdman up four oscars earlier this year - the revenant is adapted from a novel by michael punke .
watch the trailer below ( but not if you 're squeamish ) .

documents.title: tori kelly : 'youtube has changed the music industry '
text: singer tori kelly has been hovering around the fringes of the music industry for a long time .
she started singing aged three , and eight years later , won the tv talent show america 's most talented kid .

after a brief stint on american idol in her teens ( simon cowell said her powerhouse vocals were `` almost annoying '' ) , she established a gigantic fanbase on youtube , with john legend , pink and ed sheeran amongst her most famous supporters .

her debut album charted at number two in the states earlier this year and , with it poised to do the same in the uk , the 22-year-old popped in to bbc breakfast to explain how youtube has turned the music business on its head .
`` there 's a new model now , '' she said .
`` it 's almost backwards .
`` i started with the fanbase before radio , before the [ record ] label .
you start with these amazing fans , and they 're the ones out there pushing for you . ''

documents.title: florence + the machine cover justin bieber
text: fresh from a four-night engagement at the alexandra palace , florence + the machine graced the bbc 's maida vale studios this morning for a live lounge special .
although most of the set was drawn from her current number one album , how big how blue how beautiful , florence also played a cover of jack u and justin bieber 's where are u now .
you can listen to the whole set below .
the cover starts at around 23 minutes .
the full set list was :

documents.title: zane lowe unsure of the 'need ' for beats 1
text: dj zane lowe says he is unsure whether apple 's beats 1 radio station is necessary .
lowe , who quit radio 1 to front apple 's station earlier this year , made the comments in a chat with his former boss , ben cooper , at the radio festival in london .
asked why apple needs the new radio station , he said : `` i 'm not sure that they do .
we 're working this out .
time will tell .
`` we 've been going for three months .
for me to sit here and say : 'wow !
here 's 10 reasons why we need beats 1 ' i do n't know what the answer is . ''
`` i hope that there 's a place for it . ''
however , lowe was upbeat about his achievements on the station .
`` it opened up the possibility of something new to me , '' he said .
`` we found some language that is common for people and i truly believe that is music . ''

documents.title: and all that jazz
text: the bbc is launching a `` pop-up '' jazz radio station in partnership with jazz fm , marking the broadcaster 's first major collaboration with a commercial rival .

presenters from both networks - including jamie cullum , julian joseph , chris phillips and craig charles - will take part in the temporary station , which runs from 12 to 15 november , coinciding with the efg london jazz festival .
as part of the celebration , listeners are being asked to vote for the 50 greatest jazz artists .
the results will be revealed by bbc radio 3 's geoffrey smith and jazz fm presenter helen mayhew .

documents.title: beatles contract update
text: the original management contract signed by the beatles and brian epstein has been sold at auction for £ 365,000 .
the contract was sold at sotheby 's in london as part of an auction of items from pop and rock .
author: Helen Carter
BBC News Online

documents.title: sales of children 's books rise
text: the popularity of books and colouring-in titles have bolstered the children 's book market , which has increased 3.2 % in 2015 .
according to data from nielsen bookscan , £ 206m of kids ' books were bought between january and september , up £ 6.37m for the same period in 2014 .
disney 's frozen is partly-responsible , with tie-in titles seeing a surge in sales .
one of the year 's biggest books has been the dinosaur that pooped a lot , by mcbusted stars tom fletcher and dougie poynter , with sales of 144,567 copies .
author: The Bookseller

documents.title: barrymore fails to top uk box office
text: it could be a case of nominative determinism , directed at uk cinema audiences .
drew barrymore 's latest weepie miss you already has limped into the box office top five with takings of less than £ 500,000 , according to box office analysts rentrak .
the weekend was conquered once more by everest with krays film legend and the maze runner sequel the scorch trials in third and fourth respectively .
the only other new entry in the top 10 was serial killer thriller solace at number seven .

documents.title: poetry prize goes to work confronting racism
text: jamaica-born claudia rankine has won the £ 10,000 forward poetry prize for a work that one critic has described `` a fearless confrontation of casual racism '' .

citizen : an american lyric is a cutting-edge collection of lyrical prose , which includes an essay on venus williams , screengrabs of zinedine zidane 's 2006 world cup head-butt , president obama 's oath of office and witnesses describing everyday acts of racism .
she cites the example of a woman with `` multiple degrees '' who blurted out : `` i did n't think black people could get cancer '' .

that person `` is n't going to go out and shoot a black person , '' she argues , but `` they may still go on a jury and not be able to prosecute a white policeman for the killing of black people , because they still do n't understand black people as fully human . ''
read the interview

documents.title: tipping the velvet draws positive reviews
text: a new stage adaptation of lesbian drama tipping the velvet has drawn admiring reviews from uk critics .
the play , written by laura wade - who previously wrote posh - is adapted from sarah waters ' novel about a young women on a voyage of self discovery .
a 2002 television version delighted tabloids with its graphic portrayals of lesbian sex - but in the play the sexual encounters are represented by acrobatic trapeze work .
wade said : `` sex is always rather difficult to do on stage because you ca n't have close-ups in the same way that you can on film so you have to find a different way of telling that story . ''
the guardian said

documents.title: kendrick lamar goes orchestral
text: rapper kendrick lamar is to perform his hit album to pimp a butterfly in concert with the us national symphony orchestra .
the record , which reached number one in march , delves into america 's racial politics over an eclectic range of hip-hop beats , jazz excursions and p-funk samples .
it is probably the only rap album in living memory to give a prominent role to the clarinet .
lamar 's concert will take place in washington 's kennedy center on 20 october .
it comes a year after the nso backed rapper nas as he performed his seminal album illmatic to mark the 20th anniversary of its release .

documents.title: matt damon explains 'closet ' comments
text: matt damon got into hot water over the weekend , after he appeared to say gay actors should stay in the closet for the good of their careers .
here 's his quote , as given to the observer :
i think you 're a better actor the less people know about you period .
and sexuality is a huge part of that .
whether you 're straight or gay , people should n't know anything about your sexuality because that 's one of the mysteries that you should be able to play .
after the interview was published on sunday , the star appeared on ellen degeneres ' chat show .
the comedian suggested his comments had been `` twisted around '' and asked if his comments had been taken `` out of context '' .
damon appeared to suggest his quote had been deliberately mis-interpreted by journalists , saying : `` in the blogosphere , there 's no real penalty for just taking the ball and running with it .
you know what i mean ?
you 're just trying to click on your thing . ''
he then gave a fuller explanation of his comments .
i was just trying to say actors are more effective when they 're a mystery , right ?
and somebody it up and said i said gay actors should get back in the closet .
which is , like i mean it 's stupid , but it is painful when things get said that you do n't believe .
elizabeth later noted the furore over her interview on twitter .
wow .
that matt damon interview i did went a bit crazy .
@ twitterid you 've got matt damon 's lovely blood on your hands !

documents.title: film more popular than games for young people
text: young people would rather spend their pocket money on going to the cinema than buying video games , a new survey suggests .
altogether , 33 % of children aged between five and 19 said cinema was their first priority , with games a close second on 31 % .
the majority of young people - 87 % - had been to see a film in the last three months , although attendance is falling amongst 17 to 19-year-olds .
the figures were compiled by the into film festival , billed as `` the world 's biggest , free , film festival for children and young people '' .

running from 4 november , this year 's programme includes a pupil screening of the documentary film he named me malala , charting the story of nobel peace prize winner malala yousafzai , as well as q & a sessions with monty python star terry jones , aardman founder peter lord and james marsh , director of the theory of everything .

documents.title: no more exorcist movies - guaranteed
text: the exorcist is commonly hailed as the best horror movie ever made ( just ask mark kermode ) - so fans are understandably protective of the film 's legacy .
attempts at sequels have been met with scorn , not least from director william friedkin .
and when movie website deadline reported at the weekend that film company morgan creek was `` tossing around ideas '' for a remake , he took to twitter in protest .
then , after news website hitflix wrote that `` friedkin does n't seem particularly thrilled about the idea '' , he clarified his position :
after all that projectile vomiting , morgan creek sat up and took notice , issuing the following statement :
nice to have that cleared up but , to our minds , nothing will ever better french & saunders parody of the original .
for the record , we will never attempt to remake the exorcist

this prompted an avalanche of similarly-underwhelming stories .
here are some of our favourites .
have you got any similar stories ?

documents.title: chris evans wants to be 'spikier '
text: chris evans has said he would like to be `` edgier '' on air .
speaking at a radio festival event at the british library , the broadcaster said : `` i would love to be spikier , i would love to be a bit edgier sometimes but that 's not my job at the moment . ''
the broadcaster , who is in charge of the radio 2 breakfast show , told bbc presenter paddy o'connell : `` warmth is hugely important in mass entertainment .
i am not flying a spitfire , i am flying an airbus 380 and we ca n't do loop the loops .
`` we have to get everyone across safely . ''
evans also discussed the new series of top gear , which he will present following the departure of jeremy clarkson 's team .
the stunts , he said , would have to remain spectacular .
`` we ca n't do anything a kid can do in his bedroom because otherwise he 's not going to go 'tv is great ' .
you have to do extraordinary things . ''
author: The Guardian

documents.title: to twist for classic story
text: a new version of classic greek myth the odyssey is having its premiere at liverpool 's everyman theatre this week , and has been updated to tell the story of a modern-day politician who gets into a bar brawl on a diplomatic mission .
the odyssey : missing presumed dead has been written by poet simon armitage , who says it feels timely against the backdrop of the migrant crisis .
north west tonight 's andy gill went to rehearsals .
the odyssey : missing presumed dead is at the liverpool everyman until 17 october and will then go on tour .

documents.title: kenny rogers says goodbye
text: three years after a triumphant set at glastonbury , country legend kenny rogers has announced he 's retiring from touring .
`` not many people get to see the end of the rainbow , but i think i have '' he said in a video message , posted on his website .
naturally , the gambler is staging one last tour before he hangs up those cowboy boots for good .
dates will be announced soon .

documents.title: the painting that took 50,000 hours to create
text: british painter ben johnson spent a breathtaking 50,000 hours creating his de of part of the alhambra in granada , 'patio de los arrayanes ' .
besides practicing meditation , mr johnson said a difficult childhood had resulted in an ability to maintain concentration for prolonged periods .
`` concentration brings about an extraordinary stability in one 's life , and many of us come from less stable backgrounds than we would have liked , '' he told david sillito .
listen to the interview , from this morning 's edition of radio 4 's today programme .

documents.title: surprise drake album tops us chart
text: a surprise mixtape by rappers drake ( looking strangely peaceful , above ) and future has topped the weekly us billboard chart , edging out the latest album from lana del rey .
what a time to be alive , released through apple music and itunes , sold 334,000 albums , 172,000 songs and was streamed more than 35 million times , according to figures from nielsen soundscan .
it is the second number one album of the year for both artists .
del rey 's honeymoon debuted at number two while the weeknd 's beauty behind the madness dropped from number one to three .
pink floyd star david gilmour 's rattle that lock landed at number five .

documents.title: the warriors reunited
text: `` come out to plaa-aaay ``
rolling stone magazine has reunited the cast of the seminal 1979 movie the warriors for a fan event in new york .

the story about a street gang who have to make a perilous night-time journey home from manhattan to coney island after they are accused of murdering a rival gang leader , has inspired countless rip-offfs and even a video game .
spoiler : they are all pretty old now .
author: Rolling Stone

documents.title: x-files gets two-part trailer
text: it 's not on the air until january , but the publicity campaign for the x-files revival is slowly getting into gear .
we 've already had a couple of stills from the production and a brief teaser - but last night the show got two ( two ! )
trailers on us network fox , during the latest episodes of gotham and minority report .

they feature a couple of nods to the old show : mulder ( david duchovny ) destroys the `` i want to believe '' poster that used to hang in his office ; while a lingering shot of a cigarette hints at the return of the mysterious smoking man .
but it seems the six-episode series will also tackle new themes - with shots of drones and references to the nsa .
one fan has stitched the two promos together on youtube .
watch below .

documents.title: beatles contract auctioned
text: the beatles ' original management contract - which they co-signed with brian epstein - goes under the ( maxwell 's silver ) hammer at sotheby 's later today .
the document , which was drawn up in 1962 , is expected to fetch between £ 300,000 and £ 500,000 .
stay tuned to see whether it reaches its reserve .

documents.title: hartwig fischer statement
text: the british museum 's newly-appointed director , hartwig fischer , says he is `` daunted '' by the scale of his new job .

`` i never dreamt that i would be invited to be responsible for this great british institution and i am conscious that nobody could fail to grasp what the british museum represents not only for the uk but for the whole world , '' he said in a statement .
`` for many years i have looked to the british museum as a model of public engagement , critical scholarship , and international outreach .
i am of course daunted by such a responsibility but i know that nobody directs such a museum alone and the colleagues of the british museum are admired and envied around the world . ''

documents.title: tributes to catherine coulson
text: friends and colleagues have paid tribute to twin peaks star catherine coulson , who died on monday aged 71 .

documents.title: big bang break-up
text: kaley cuoco - who plays penny in the us sitcom the big bang theory - announced over the weekend that she was ending her marriage to tennis player ryan sweeting after 20 months .
court documents released on monday suggest the divorce will be finalised smoothly , as the couple signed a prenuptial agreement .
the agreement , signed in november 2013 , outlines cuoco 's spousal support payments to sweeting and how the couple will divide their assets .
the filing states cuoco and sweeting separated earlier this month , but provides no further details about the breakup .

documents.title: pride of britain glamour
text: lots of celebrities turned up for last night 's pride of britain awards , which honour some of the country 's bravest people .
among those recognised were british aid workers who helped treat ebola victims in west africa and the medics who rescued victims of the alton towers rollercoaster crash .
the strictly celebrities were there , as were the little mix girls and , of course , the hoff ( above , with hayley roberts ) .
some sterling red carpet work follows from the likes of former girls aloud stars kimberley walsh , nicola roberts and cheryl fernandez-versini , david beckham and this morning host holly willoughby .
even the osbournes made an effort to look their best
but
one celebrity let the side down a little looking like he just rolled out of bed
come on simon .

documents.title: paul walker 's daughter sues porsche
text: the daughter of actor paul walker is to sue porsche over the crash in which he died , according to us media reports .
the fast and furious star was a passenger in a 2005 porsche carrera gt when the driver lost control and crashed into trees and a power pole in los angeles two years ago .
meadow walker claims the carmaker skimped on safety features which could have either prevented the crash or kept walker alive , according to a wrongful death case filed on monday .

documents.title: british museum appoints new director
text: a few days after it was leaked to the times , the british museum has confirmed that german art historian hartwig fischer will replace neil macgregor as its director .
the appointment was approved by david cameron on monday .

documents.title: smithers comes out at last
text: after nearly three decades of dancing around the obvious , waylon smithers from the simpsons will finally come out of the closest , according to show producer al jean .
after years of fetishising his decrepit boss montgomery burns , the closeted mr smithers gets `` fed up with burns not appreciating him and considers his options '' says jean .
`` in springfield now , most people know he 's gay , but obviously burns does n't . ''

documents.title: twin peaks ' log lady dies
text: actress catherine coulson , best known for playing the log lady on twin peaks , has died aged 71 .

one of david lynch 's most frequent collaborators , she appeared in his 1974 short film the amputee and worked as a crewmember on eraserhead before playing margaret lanterman , the enigmatic log lady , in both seasons of twin peaks .
`` today , i lost one of my dearest friends , '' lynch said on hearing news of her death .
`` catherine was solid gold .
she was always there for her friends - she was filled with love for all people , for her family , for her work .
she was a tireless worker . ''
she had a great sense of humour - she loved to laugh and make people laugh .
she was a spiritual person - a longtime tm ( transcendental meditation ) meditator .
she was the log lady . ''
author: The Hollywood Reporter

documents.title: noah makes daily show debut
text: jon stewart 's replacement trevor noah has made his debut as host of the daily show in the us .
according to variety , `` noah 's debut found him looking more at ease and in command than he ever did as a correspondent . ''
however , deadline remarked on `` a first night that was mostly inoffensive but also mostly flat . ''
here is his opening monologue

documents.title: good morning , one and all
text: it 's that time again for your daily injection of all the arts , entertainment , media and cultural goodness we have to offer .

we 'll see how jon stewart 's daily show replacement trevor noah has gone down with critics , we 'll have a gander at some of the frocks at last night 's pride of britain awards plus doc brown is back ( in time ) in a new short .
so stick with us `` where we 're going , we do n't need roads ``
author: Kev Geoghegan
Arts and entertainment reporter
